title: Playing a mage into Yasuo is really fun
body:
Ever tried playing {{champion:99}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:134}} into this guy?

Between his shield, wind wall and dashes it's near impossible to harass him. And even if you do, he just takes Feast, the 2% life-steal mastery and {{item:1055}} and can be full health after a wave of minions. There's no downtime between him windwalling your abilities, shielding your abilities, dodging your abilities or healing off minions.

I don't know why he's allowed to have such a good laning phase (resourceless, mobile) combined with one of the best assassin late-games.

At least you can buy {{item:3157}} {{item:3139}} for Zed, nothing stops Yasuo ulting off his team's knock-ups and hitting you for 1800+ damage with Q+AA.

replies.body:
wow, counterpicks exist, color me tickled.

{{champion:90}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:50}} will laugh in his face and then eat him

> [{quoted}](name=Hextech Gunbard,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IUqeBK9x,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-11-21T13:09:58.331+0000)

> 
> {{champion:90}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:50}} will laugh in his face and then eat him

How many players do you think main (or even play) those champions xD their popularity is not top of the shelf mate xD
_ahem_
LOL
I thought you mained Draven. ;p

I main malz. Lol

Even with all these changes in the patch malz actually got even better with the buff to rod of ages ap. 

You should pick him up. If the fight is just a 1v1 you'll majority win it even if your behind and at least level 6.

The most exciting 1v1.

Yasuo: "Ha! Look at my fancy dashes! Try to hit me now Mr. Prophet--"

Malz: "BWAAAAAAAAAAAAAA"

*A bitch has been slain.*

{{champion:96}} Ugh. Why does our "Prophet" have to vomit on everything. It's disgusting!
{{champion:6}} Seriously man. Show some dignity.
{{champion:38}} (>_>)
that moment when you puke so much, kogmaw starts complaining

So the problem could be that people want to play champions that Yasuo counters, not that he's too strong. If you pick Lux into Yasuo you deserve the frustration of laning against him. Instead try picking {{champion:1}}, {{champion:112}}, {{champion:90}} who aren't entirely skill shot reliant, and who tend to do fairly well in lane against him.

Let me be clear that I think that Yasuo may be too strong, but complaining about a champ when you are picking champs he directly counters isn't really a fair assessment.

> [{quoted}](name=RogueWill,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IUqeBK9x,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-11-21T14:44:54.433+0000)
>
> How many players do you think main (or even play) those champions xD their popularity is not top of the shelf mate xD

Who cares? Not our problem. I'll enjoy playing Malz while you keep crying that yasuo is "op"
I know {{champion:30}} is SUPPOSED to be good against Yasuo since you can just Q him behind his wind wall... problem is, then he just dashes into my face and then stuff happens..

> [{quoted}](name=D2Vincent,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IUqeBK9x,comment-id=00030005,timestamp=2015-11-21T18:29:12.260+0000)
> he just dashes into my face and then stuff happens..

Show me on the Tibbers where the bad Yasuo touched you.

*gets his keyboard and points to his R button* He hit me here....and there was nothing I could do...*sob* I exhausted him...I EXHAUSTED HIM and I kept Q'ing and I had my W down and my E up but THEN HE ULTED ME*sob*....and I thought I could him while I was in my passive but he got his stupid shield thing came up and he managed to survive.. *more sobbing* just please...MAKE THE NIGHTMARES GO AWAY...
You don't pick Karthus to win lane. You pick him to farm for 20+ minutes, wade into the enemy team, and laugh when they think killing you is going to save them.

This argument is ridiculous.

Every character has a counter pick - does a character need to be utterly unbeatable before they're considered a problem? No single character should be able to skewer balance to the point where their kit makes 90% of an entire _class_ of character irrelevant against them.

You mean like how {{champion:115}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:134}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:268}}  have made life absolutely miserable for most melee champions at their peak?

god forbid one of those melees can fight them in lane

All those characters were promptly nerfed when they were found to be imbalanced and create issues where their lane match-up was decided before the match even began. 

Yasuo has been game-warping all season, and is even moreso now than ever. Also did {{champion:31}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:238}} suddenly stop existing?

people say this like yasuo was never nerfed. he has received about 7 nerfs since his release and was some of them were to make him squishier. I believe most of the people against yasuo are just people who can't deal with fighting him or don't like his champ. no one ever list any of his weaknesses they just randomly spew out all of his mechanics and say you can't fight him. It's complete garbage.

I can tell you what his problem is - it's that his weaknesses are few and far between.

People are stuck in a loop with Yasuo (and I talk about this in other threads) because while Yasuo's kit is overloaded (and "broken"), he's not really overpowered (in a traditional sense). He's a character that, theoretically, can be dealt with, but even if you deal with him he's eventually capable of scaling back into being a threat (and really quite quickly).

The root of the problem can be found in Yasuo's double passive. He doubles his crit AND he gets a shield for moving around. The shield is fine - thematically it makes sense and fits on the character very nicely, and it allows him to lane against some matchups that can be very difficult for him in the level 1-2 range. His crit passive needs to be on an ability (and scale with ranks in said ability) OR it needs to scale with level though, because his capability to have 100% crit at like 15 minutes if he snowballs is just unreal. There's no reason that a character who has access to 100% crit with shiv + crit cloak (less than 4k gold investment) should be able to do it at level 5 if they get ahead. It's why the community complaints are so useless - most people just say "oh his laning is good" (it's not really that great against a lot of people due to his shield and tankiness nerfs) or that his windwall counters them or whatever, but that's not really the point - the point is that laning against Yasuo can feel oppressive and then his teamfights continue to feel oppressive right off the bat with little item investment. He's a character with the capacity to bully a lot of popular mage matchups (especially with smart farming and pushing strategies depending on the matchup) who also spikes incredibly early and VERY hard due to doubling all crit chance. Is he beatable in lane? Definitely. Lots of character even have super favorable matchups with him ({{champion:55}} {{champion:91}} come to mind as two assassins that can pretty easily outplay Yasuo at most stages of the game) but to those who enjoy playing mages like {{champion:99}} {{champion:103}} or {{champion:134}} it can be super cancerous because there's not much you can do aside from not play into those matchups (which, in blind pick, is impossible to determine).

There are some very easy tweaks that would leave Yasuo's mid and late game spikes the same, wouldn't significantly harm his laning, but would make that 100% crit less accessible to him early on in the game, and I think they need to happen. That's the one part of Yasuo's kit I feel can be oppressive no matter what - because of the miniscule gold investment after Shiv to get 100% crit (I mean, it's 800 gold for a crit cloak and then you have 100%), he has access to this huge spike in damage really early on. Would it really be so unreasonable to gate the crits until level 11? Or give his crits an Ashe like mechanic where, with just those two crit items, his crits wouldn't do insane damage? I don't know what the fix is, exactly, but having his crit work the way it does now makes it incredibly frustrating to play against, because even if you're beating Yasuo a lot of times once he achieves 100% crit he can still easily kill you.

> [{quoted}](name=Hextech Gunbard,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IUqeBK9x,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-11-21T13:09:58.331+0000)

because they will always pick yasuo first.

You actually can QSS his ultimate, as it is a suppression. And unlike with Zed, Yasuo will still be stuck in the animation while you get away.

Edit: Love how I get downvotes for nicely correcting the post. This community lol. Have you ever considered that Yasuo isn't the only person in the game? Maybe, for example, Annie is mid and Yasuo is top. If you get the QSS to lane against Annie, you can **still use it** against Yasuo. Maybe if you are against Yasuo, you don't even rush the QSS and get it after 2 items and boots. This is valuable information to know, kids.
yah, building straight MR into someone who has infinite AD harass and waveclear sounds awesome.

It is not a supression but rather a suspension like Nami bubble

You can QSS to remove the stun but ur still up in the air

>

No it's a proven fact that you can move while he's still finishing his animation.
Why yes, I do enjoy playing a mage into Yasuo {{champion:90}}

He shoves the lane. Throws his tornado. You let yourself get hit, then ult him under your tower. Watch the QQ /dance
{{champion:1}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:50}} The Justice League.
Annie is really good against Yas, the most he can do is block q which is on a 4 second cooldown anyway.
welcome to the league of justice!{{champion:119}}

> [{quoted}](name=Albion,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IUqeBK9x,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-11-21T12:21:09.360+0000)
>
> Ever tried playing {{champion:99}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:134}} into this guy?
> 
> Between his shield, wind wall and dashes it's near impossible to harass him. And even if you do, he just takes Feast, the 2% life-steal mastery and {{item:1055}} and can be full health after a wave of minions. There's no downtime between him windwalling your abilities, shielding your abilities, dodging your abilities or healing off minions.
> 
> I don't know why he's allowed to have such a good laning phase (resourceless, mobile) combined with one of the best assassin late-games.
> 
> At least you can buy {{item:3157}} {{item:3139}} for Zed, nothing stops Yasuo ulting off his team's knock-ups and hitting you for 1800+ damage with Q+AA.

He is a very aggressive laner, with the damage and tools to back it up, but he has 0 escape, is too team reliant, goes glass cannon and can be easily focused, and can be harassed when his wall is off cooldown. The problem with you is that you're fighting him in your minion wave, and letting him stack his E damage up, then complaining about him being some bullshit broken champ.  Instead you can roam and get kills elsewhere, and dodge his tornado, his ONLY way of getting his ult off in a 1v1. Late game, you should treat him like a Yi or Kat, focus him before anyone else, as he is a glass cannon type champ, if he has 2 defensive items, he loses out on A LOT of damage, and is still somewhat easy to kill. The problem with Yasuo isn't Yasuo, it's you.

The problem with you is that you're fighting him in your minion wave, and letting him stack his E damage up, then complaining about him being some bullshit broken champ.  Instead you can roam and get kills elsewhere, and dodge his tornado, his ONLY way of getting his ult off in a 1v1. Late game, you should treat him like a Yi or Kat, focus him before anyone else, as he is a glass cannon type champ, if he has 2 defensive items, he loses out on A LOT of damage, and is still somewhat easy to kill. The problem with Yasuo isn't Yasuo, it's you.

lol so dont go near your minions? k ill just save "don't try to cs at all" to my list of yasuo counterplay.
Yasuo is a near perfect lane freezer/cser. He controls the entire creep wave while taking out half your hp with one e q auto and leaving unscathed

It's not like he has one of the highest movement speeds in the game, combined with a dash ability and an innate shield + cock block wall!
Yah, Yasuo is an aggressive laner. He shoves the fuck out of your lane and there's nothing you can do about it unless your jungler sits in your lane (and even then, there' no guarantee he wont get away easily, especially when you're behind trying to CS under your turret). That's the definition of toxic gameplay.

> he just takes Feast, the 2% life-steal mastery and and can be full health after a wave of minions

[Feast](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Feast) has 20 seconds cooldown. Maybe you are talking about [Warlord's Bloodlust](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Warlord's_Bloodlust_%28Season_2016_Mastery%29), which only triggers against enemy champions.
Feast have a 20 second cooldown, but minion waves come every 30 seconds. He can proc it every time a minion wave comes, that's what he's talking about.

We won't pretend he's gonna get full-health from 5% total lifesteal and 20 hp every 20 second, though. So, while Yasuo still sucks ass to play against as a skillshot-based mage, hyperbole isn't helping.

The problem is it's so hard to poke him through his shield and wall unless the Yasuo is just awful. Then you FINALLY manage to get some kind of meaningful poke off.
life steal, feast, regen, maybe health pot > full health.

anything less then 25% of his heal will pretty much get healed off without the pot.
And even while he's still regening, his shield will probably come back up and allow him to start playing aggressively again even faster then that.
For how HARD it is to get him down, it should be at least somewhat rewarding. It feels like Yauso punishes me for doing anything, since any damage dealt to him is a waste of mana and even if I try to passive farm he'll use his windwall to be a fucking asshole.
hes talking about the 2% spellvamp/lifesteal mastery that no one uses

> [{quoted}](name=Kaiceytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IUqeBK9x,comment-id=000d0001,timestamp=2015-11-21T16:21:12.802+0000)
>
> hes talking about the 2% spellvamp/lifesteal mastery that no one uses

Uh what mate? Vampirism is superior to Natural Talent on every champion that stacks AD. .55AD per level is crap compared to 2% LS that is provided at lv 1.
Yeah ever steamer I've watched says Natural Talent is complete garbage and takes vampirism instead on EVERY champion that goes into the ferocity tree including ap champs.

I feel like I'm the only person that enjoys playing against Yasuo as {{champion:43}} .

Although, I might be the only person playing Karma. 

Too bad Riot removed the bonus damage from Mantra W, would make this match up even more fun.

I'll agree with the general consensus that complaining about Yasuo being strong against certain picks is a weak arguement if you're hoping for  a rebalance. He has enough counters to where that's not the biggest issue.

When I complain about Yasuo, it's because he he has 2 different passives each individually as powerful as the average champion passive; he's a manaless champ with 2 high damage skills on less than a second cooldown; while as a melee assassin, he needs mobility, but unlike other melee assasins, his mobility skill is essentially always up allowing him to dodge with ridiculous consistency on top of his survivability skill and passive; although he's an assassin, and he has 2 forms of hard CC (the only assassin including ranged like this).

If you ignore who he's playing against and just look at his kit, you better realize There are certain aspects he doesn't need on top of everything else. Mainly the extra crit passive that only serves to give him extra damage and isn't necessary for his kit at all. And I would really appreciate if his dash could be used repeatedly like it is now, but once he doesn't use it for 2 seconds or something, it goes on a 5 sec or something CD so there's actually a window of opportunity to attack highly skilled Yasuo players.

What 2 high damage skills? You mean Q and E? The ones that have 100 and 150 base damage at max rank respectively? Or do you mean the ult that has a completely broken 400 base damage at lvl 16? Complain about Yasuo all you want, but don't complain about the damage on his skills, because they're complete garbage.

> [{quoted}](name=Slamurai Jack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=IUqeBK9x,comment-id=002a0000,timestamp=2015-11-21T18:29:35.462+0000)
>
> What 2 high damage skills? You mean Q and E? The ones that have 100 and 150 base damage at max rank respectively? Or do you mean the ult that has a completely broken 400 base damage at lvl 16? Complain about Yasuo all you want, but don't complain about the damage on his skills, because they're complete garbage.

Very valid point for those Yasuos who don't build AD. But I was referring to the other 99% of the playerbase.

ive had good luck fighting yasuo with {{champion:131}} i still think he is cancer though since mid game i struggle killing him even as diana with him criting every fucking hit and my armor means nothing against crits

at high level of play, she is not a counter. Yasuo WANTS to get on your face, and if he knows what he's doing, Diana will lose the trade. If you check champion.gg, yasuo has one of the highest win rates against Diana.
Xerath works pretty well. His Q, W and R cant be windwalled.
His E can though, literally unplayable /s.
